CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Note: The Avid Film Composer is a digital, non-linear, 24 frame-per-second editing machine usinig compression algorithms, that has revolutionized the art of film editing. Shots can be stored, recalled, manipulated and played back instantaneously, allowing the film editor unprecedented creative freedom and the ability to realize a film more fully than before.
Citation: To AVID TECHNOLOGY, INC. for the concept, system design and engineering of the Avid Film Composer for motion picture editing.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Dr. Thomas G. Stockham Jr., Robert B. Ingebretsen
Note: The foundation of current digital audio editing equipment for motion pictures has its roots in the late seventies work of these digital pioneers.
Citation: To DR. THOMAS G. STOCKHAM, JR. and ROBERT B. INGEBRETSEN for their pioneering work in the areas of waveform editing, crossfades and cut-and-paste techniques for digital audio editing.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: This early work in systems architecture and software has had a significant impact on the digital creation of sound effects and the editing of audio for motion picture sound tracks.
Citation: To JAMES A. MOORER for his pioneering work in the design of digital signal processing and its application to audio editing for film.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: This specially designed ground fault interrupter eliminates the electric shock hazard when working in water, wet conditions or from an accidentally exposed power line.
Citation: To STEPHEN J. KAY of K-Tec Corporation for the design and development of the Shock Block.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Gary Tregaskis, Dominique Boisvert, Philippe Panzini, ANDRÉ LeBLANC
Note: The Inferno System, and its predecessor, Flame, provide high-speed, efficient integrated digital compositing and visual effects tools.
Citation: To GARY TREGASKIS for the primary design; and to DOMINIQUE BOISVERT, PHILIPPE PANZINI and ANDRÉ LeBLANC for the development and implementation of the Flame and Inferno software.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Robert Predovich, John Scott, Mohamed Ken T. Husain, Cameron Shearer
Note: The Soundmaster system provides motion picture audio post production facilities with a completely integrated capability for synchronization of audio and picture elements with the numerous methods of synchronization in use today.
Citation: To ROBERT PREDOVICH, JOHN SCOTT, MOHAMED KEN T. HUSAIN and CAMERON SHEARER for the design and implementation of the Soundmaster Integrated Operations Nucleus operating environment.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Roy B. Ference, Steven R. Schmidt, Richard J. Federico, Rockwell Yarid, MICHAEL E. McCRACKAN
Note: The Kodak Lightning laser recorder system established higher operational and quality standards and achieved wide industry acceptance for digital film recording onto intermediate film stock.
Citation: To ROY B. FERENCE, STEVEN R. SCHMIDT, RICHARD J. FEDERICO, ROCKWELL YARID and MICHAEL E. McCRACKAN for the design and development of the Kodak Lightning Laser Recorder.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Colin Mossman, HANS LEISINGER, GEORGE JOHN ROWLAND
Note: This innovative and effective high speed film cleaning machine is unique in its use of spray technology, providing the flexibility to use alternative solvents, and to anticipate changes in environmental legislation.
Citation: To COLIN MOSSMAN, HANS LEISINGER and GEORGE JOHN ROWLAND of Deluxe Laboratories for the concept and design of the Deluxe High Speed Spray Film Cleaner.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: The 435 enhances the creative process via its programmability and reliability, and provides the camera operator with the widest feature and performance capability of any MOS camera in use today.
Citation: To ARNOLD & RICHTER CINE TECHNIK, and ARRI USA, INC. for the concept and engineering of the Arriflex 435 Camera System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Arnold Richter Cine Technik, Carl Zeiss Company
Note: This series of variable prine lenses opens many creative possibilities, since any focal length can be continuously selected throughout the entire range. They offer sharp, high-contrast, high-resolution images with minimized vignetting, superior to many prime lenses.
Citation: To ARNOLD & RICHTER CINE TECHNIK and the CARL ZEISS COMPANY for the concept and optical design of the Carl Zeiss/Arriflex Variable Prime Lenses.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: The Aurasoft offers a radical new type of reflector design for the production of soft, very even and relatively shadowless light, with superior coverage and significantly higher intensity than existing softlights.
Citation: To DEREK C. LIGHTBODY of OpTex for the design and development of Aurasoft Luminaires.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Mark Roberts, Ronan Carroll, Assaff Rawner, Paul Bartlett, Simon Wakley
Note: This radically original and effective solution to the problems of high-speed camera motion was achieved with the combination of novel geometry and dedicated 3-dimensional control software.
Citation: To MARK ROBERTS, RONAN CARROLL, ASSAFF RAWNER, PAUL BARTLETT and SIMON WAKLEY for the creation of the Milo Motion-Control Crane.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Michael Sorensen, Richard Alexander, Donald Trumbull
Note: Over the past decade, Sorensen, Alexander and Trumbull have improved the speed, repeatability and portability of robotic camera platforms through novel engineering concepts and the pioneering use of composite materials.
Citation: To MICHAEL SORENSEN and RICHARD ALEXANDER of Sorensen Designs International, and DONALD TRUMBULL for advancing the state-of-the-art of real-time motion-control, as exemplified in the Gazelle and Zebra camera dolly systems.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Ronald E. Uhlig, THOMAS F. POWERS, FRED M. FUSS
Note: KeyKode numbers are machine-readable bar codes on camera negative films that exactly replicate the human-readable key numbers. Together with an appropriate reader and database software, they reduce errors and speed important post-production operations, leading to significant cost savings.
Citation: To RONALD E. UHLIG, THOMAS F. POWERS and FRED M. FUSS of the Eastman Kodak Company for the design and development of KeyKode latent-image barcode key numbers.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Iain Neil, Takuo Miyagishima, Panavision Incorporated
Note: The Primo Series of lenses for 35mm cinematography represents a thorough and comprehensive approach to prime lens design, development and manufacture. This family of lenses has a wide range of focal lengths, all color matched, with improved modulation transfer function characteristics.
Citation: To IAIN NEIL for the optical design; TAKUO MIYAGISHIMA for the mechanical design; and PANAVISION, INCORPORATED, for the concept and development of the Primo Series of spherical prime lenses for 35mm cinematography.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This cable-driven, manned camera platform allows the operator to spin 360 degrees for unimpeded pans while controlling the downhill speed via brakes. As a device for achieving otherwise impossible shots, Skyman has had a definite influence on later cable-suspended camera systems.
Citation: To GARRETT BROWN and JERRY HOLWAY for the creation of the Skyman flying platform for Steadicam operators.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: James Rodnunsky, James Webber, Bob Webber, Trou Bayliss
Note: This radio-controlled, cable-driven camera platform with its ultra-smooth synthetic cables and powerful hydraulic motors, enables runs in excess of 3000 feet with quick return to start. Operating unmanned, it can function at speeds and through perils that would be unsafe for on-board operators.
Citation: To JAMES RODNUNSKY, JAMES WEBBER and BOB WEBBER of Cablecam Systems, and TROU BAYLISS for the design and engineering of Cablecam.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: DAVID DiFRANCESCO, Bala S. Manian, Thomas L. Noggle
Note: This pioneering laser film recorder, designed and used for motion pictures, demonstrated the potential of this technology for recording digital data onto intermediate film stock.
Citation: To DAVID DiFRANCESCO, BALA S. MANIAN and THOMAS L. NOGGLE for their pioneering efforts in the development of laser film recording technology.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: MICHAEL MacKENZIE, MIKE BOLLES, UDO PAMPEL, JOSEPH FULMER
Note: This silent, high-speed motion control modification of a Panther dolly makes it possible to film moving camera composite shots of actors while recording live dialogue.
Citation: To MICHAEL MacKENZIE, MIKE BOLLES, UDO PAMPEL and JOSEPH FULMER of Industrial Light & Magic for their pioneering work in motion-controlled, silent camera dollies.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Barry Walton, BILL SCHULTZ, CHRIS BARKER, DAVID CORNELIUS
Note: This extensive modification to the Panther dolly allows high-speed moves to be silent, smooth and stable.
Citation: To BARRY WALTON, BILL SCHULTZ, CHRIS BARKER and DAVID CORNELIUS of Sony Pictures Imageworks for the creation of an advanced motion-controlled, silent camera dolly.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: These components have become the de facto industry standard for use in precision motion control equipment.
Citation: To BRUCE WILTON and CARLOS ICINKOFF of Mechanical Concepts for their modular system of motion-control rotators and movers for use in motion-control.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Remy Smith, James K. Branch, Nasir J. Zaidi
Note: The design and execution of the Spectra Professional IV-A meter has resulted in a practical and successful tool for the film production community.
Citation: To REMY SMITH for the software and electronic design and development; and JAMES K. BRANCH and NASIR J. ZAIDI for the design and development of the Spectra Professional IV-A digital exposure meter.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Through years of persistent effort, Mr. Kruglak has commercialized and popularized a technique of great utility for motion picture camera operations. By introducing diversity antennas and a time code insertion accessory, he has optimized camera wireless video-assist components.
Citation: To IVAN KRUGLAK for his commitment to the development of a wireless transmission system for video-assisted images for the motion picture industry.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: The TRACK system is an integrated software tool that uses computer-vision techniques to extract critical 2D and 3D information about a scene and the camera used to film it.
Citation: To DR. DOUGLAS R. ROBLE for his contribution to tracking technology and for the design and implementation of the TRACK system for camera position calculation and scene reconstruction.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Ras_track allows the user to determine the postiton and location of the camera and objects in a scene by tracking points in a scanned sequence.
Citation: To THADDEUS BEIER for the design and implementation of ras_track, a system for 2D tracking, stabilization, and 3D camera and object tracking.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Manfred N. Klemme, Donald E. Wetzel
Note: The K-TEK series microphone boom pole provides production recording personnel with a self-lubricated, light-weight, sturdy pole with multiple accessories.
Citation: To MANFRED N. KLEMME and DONALD E. WETZEL for the design and development of the K-Tek Microphone Boom Pole and accessories for on-set motion picture sound recording.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This software technique provides an efficient and flexible method for the creation of flowing streams, oceans, tidal waves and turbulence for motion picture visual effects.
Citation: To NICK FOSTER for his software development in the field of water simulation systems.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: By integrating existing tools into a powerful interactive system, and adding an expressive multi-target shape interpolation-based freeform animation system, the \"Caricature\" system provides a degree of subtlety and refinement not possible with other systems.
Citation: To CARY PHILLIPS for the design and development of the \"Caricature\" Animation System at Industrial Light & Magic.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: DR. MITCHELL J. BOGDANOWICZ, JIM MEYER, STAN MILLER
Note: Designed to correspond to the spectral sensitivity of color negative film stocks, these filters provide for improved color control in motion picture lighting.
Citation: To DR. MITCHELL J. BOGDANOWICZ of the Eastman Kodak Company, and JIM MEYER and STAN MILLER of Rosco Laboratories, Inc. for the design of the CalColor Calibrated Color Effects Filters.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Dr. A. Tulsi Ram, RICHARD C. SEHLIN, DR. CARL F. HOLTZ. DAVID F. KOPPERL
Note: The use of zeolite crystals as molecular sieves to absorb moisture, acetic acid, methylene chloride and a variety of solvents created an effective deterrent to the effects of vinegar syndrome in stored film stock.
Citation: To DR. A. TULSI RAM, RICHARD C. SEHLIN, DR. CARL F. HOLTZ and DAVID F. KOPPERL of the Eastman Kodak Company for the research and development of the concept of molecular sieves applied to improve the archival properties of processed photographic film.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This leveler keeps the camera eyepiece at the same level, regardless of whether the camera position is tilted up or down, enabling the camera operator to concentrate on the composition of the image.
Citation: To TAKUO MIYAGISHIMA and ALBERT K. SAIKI of Panavision, Inc. for the design and development of the Eyepiece Leveler.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: EDMUND M. DI GIULIO, JAMES BARTELL
Note: The KeyKode Sync Reader provides a fast, accurate and user-friendly means of utilizing the KeyKode information on film, thereby expediting the editorial and post-production processes.
Citation: To EDMUND M. DI GIULIO and JAMES BARTELL of Cinema Products for the design of the KeyKode Sync Reader.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Time code slates have had significant impact on the filmmaking process by simplifying post-production. This development makes the synchronization process faster and more precise, particularly when multiple cameras are used.
Citation: To IVAN KRUGLAK for his pioneering concept and the development of the Coherent Time Code Slate.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Due to their features and simplified operational procedures, the Denecke slates have had significant impact on the motion picture industry and have become the standard for electronic time code slates.
Citation: To MIKE DENECKE for refining and further developing electronic time code slates.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: ED ZWANEVELD, FREDERICK GASOI, MIKE LAZARIDIS, DALE BRUBACHER-CRESSMAN
Note: The DigiSync Film KeyKode Reader provides a fast, accurate and user-friendly means of utilizing the KeyKode information on film, expediting the editorial and post-production processes.
Citation: To ED ZWANEVELD and FREDERICK GASOI of the National Film Board of Canada, and MIKE LAZARIDIS and DALE BRUBACHER-CRESSMAN of Research in Motion for the design and development of the DigiSync Film KeyKode Reader.

CanonicalCategory: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Category: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Citation: To David W. Gray in appreciation for outstanding service and dedication in upholding the high standards of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

Roderick T. Ryan

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: The Libra III head can accept a range of film cameras and their lenses and allows the operator to add stabilization to each axis for medium focal length lenses. Motion capture and playback are also selectable features.
Citation: To NICK PHILLIPS for the design and development of the three-axis Libra III remote control camera head.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: The quiet Moviecam Superlight is an extremely small and light 35mm professional motion picture sound camera which allows the cinematographer to film in ways and situations that were never before possible.
Citation: To FRITZ GABRIEL BAUER for the concept, design and engineering of the Moviecam Superlight 35mm Motion Picture Camera.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Iain Neil, Rick Gelbard, Panavision Inc.
Note: This unique and versatile viewfinder with two independent viewing positions provides a very high-resolution video assist image, greatly enhancing its application for on-set compositing or non-linear editing.
Citation: To IAIN NEIL for the optical design, RICK GELBARD for the mechanical design, and PANAVISION, INC. for the development of the Millennium Camera System viewfinder.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Huw Gwilym, Karl Lynch, Mark V. Crabtree
Note: This console allows the user multi-position mixing capabilities, stem routing predub inputs and other filmcentric attributes. This is the first fully digital audio mixing console specifically designed for post-production film mixing.
Citation: To HUW GWILYM, KARL LYNCH and MARK V. CRABTREE for the design and development of the AMS Neve Logic Digital Film Console for motion picture sound mixing.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: James Moultrie, Mike Salter, Mark Craig Gerchman
Note: These state-of-the-art fixed focal length 35mm lenses are the result of intense efforts to meet industry requirements in several areas. Providing superior performance in several cinematographic aspects, these lenses include a unique linear focus system.
Citation: To JAMES MOULTRIE for the mechanical design, and to MIKE SALTER and MARK CRAIG GERCHMAN for the optical design of the Cooke S4 Range of Fixed Focal Length Lenses for 35mm motion picture photography.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: The impact of the Electro-formed Metal Reflector over the decades has completely changed the presentation side of the motion picture industry allowing the replacement of the carbon arc light source and the implementation of automated projection systems.
Citation: To MARLOWE A. PICHEL for development of the process for manufacturing Electro-formed Metal Reflectors which, when combined with the DC Short Arc Xenon Lamp, became the worldwide standard for motion picture projection systems.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: These radically new motion picture film projectors provide superior print handling, image steadiness, screen illumination and enhanced viewer experience by means of an extremely simple air-driven mechanical transport system.
Citation: To L. RON SCHMIDT for the concept, design and engineering of the Linear Loop Film Projectors.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: Materials of uniform color characteristics are implanted between layers of optical glass and bonded together under extremes of heat and pressure. The outer surfaces are ground and polished to specified close tolerances, free of distortion and resistant to changes in temperature or humidity, then bound with a protective metal ring.
Citation: To NAT TIFFEN of Tiffen Manufacturing Corporation for the production of high-quality, durable, laminated color filters for motion picture photography.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Designed to eliminate physical acoustical rumble and to mask a microphone's high sensitivity to wind and other unwanted noises, the lightweight and rugged Rycote Microphone Windshields accomplish these tasks without altering or impairing the original frequency response of the microphone.
Citation: To VIVIENNE DYER and CHRIS WOOLF for the design and development of the Rycote Microphone Windshield Modular System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Designed to eliminate physical acoustical rumble and to cover a microphone's high sensitivity to wind and other unwanted noises, the Light Wave Systems line of shock mounts and windscreens accomplish these tasks without altering or impairing the original frequency response of the microphone.
Citation: To LESLIE DREVER for the design and development of the Light Wave microphone windscreens and isolation mounts from Light Wave Systems.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Richard C. Sehlin, DR. MITCHELL J. BOGDANOWICZ, MARY L. SCHMOEGER
Note: The ELM Filters enable a laboratory to achieve additive printer contrast and color reproduction using a subtractive lamphouse.
Citation: To RICHARD C. SEHLIN for the concept, and DR. MITCHELL J. BOGDANOWICZ and MARY L. SCHMOEGER of the Eastman Kodak Company for the design and development of the Eastman Lamphouse Modification Filters.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Hoyt H. Yeatman Jr., JOHN C. BREWER
Note: The elimination of the \"red fringe\" artifact in traveling matte composite photography obviates expensive additional computerized image processing thus reducing the time involved in producing a seamless and convincing composite shot.
Citation: To HOYT H. YEATMAN, JR. of Dream Quest Images and JOHN C. BREWER of the Eastman Kodak Company for the identification and diagnosis leading to the elimination of the \"red fringe\" artifact in traveling matte composite photography.

To FPC, Incorporated, under the leadership of Barry M. Stultz and Milton Jan Friedman, for the development and implementation of an environmentally responsible program to recycle or destroy discarded motion picture prints.

CanonicalCategory: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Category: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Citation: To Edmund M. Di Giulio in appreciation for outstanding service and dedication in upholding the high standards of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

CanonicalCategory: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Category: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Citation: To Takuo Miyagishima in appreciation for outstanding service and dedication in upholding the high standards of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Nominees: Rob Cook, Loren Carpenter, Ed Catmull
Note: Their broad professional influence in the industry continues to inspire and contribute to the advancement of computer-generated imagery for motion pictures.
Citation: To ROB COOK, LOREN CARPENTER and ED CATMULL for their significant advancements to the field of motion picture rendering as exemplified in Pixar's \"Renderman.\"

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Al Mayer Sr., Al Mayer Jr., Iain Neil, Brian Dang
Note: This camera brings the full uncompromised performance of larger heavy-duty cameras to the lightest weight category with ruggedness and advanced features previously expected only in specialized or effects cameras.
Citation: To AL MAYER, SR. and AL MAYER, JR., for the mechanical design, IAIN NEIL for the optical design and BRIAN DANG for the electronic design of the Panavision Millennium XL Camera System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Joe Wary, Gerald Painter, Colin F. Mossman
Note: This release print system at Deluxe Laboratories utilizes a revolutionary design allowing for higher print volumes, reduced space requirements for loop racks and elevators, and safer operation.
Citation: To JOE WARY, GERALD PAINTER and COLIN F. MOSSMAN for the design and development of the Deluxe Laboratories Multi Roller Film Transport System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: This camera motor, operated with programmable microprocessors, achieves an unprecedented range of precisely controlled speeds in stand-alone cameras or when synchronized to motion-control systems.
Citation: To ALVAH J. MILLER and PAUL JOHNSON of Lynx Robotics for the electronic and software design of the Lynx C-50 Camera Motor System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: [These] digital audio dubbers have afforded the post-production community a faster, more cost-effective means of playing back hundreds of digital audio tracks for pre-mixing or final mixing in creating motion picture sound tracks. They also offer individual track slipping in multiple track configurations, random access recall, and both destructive and non-destructive editing capabilities, eliminating the requirements for razor blade conforming.
Citation: To AKAI DIGITAL for the design and development of the DD8plus digital audio dubber specifically designed for the motion picture industry.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: [These] digital audio dubbers have afforded the post-production community a faster, more cost-effective means of playing back hundreds of digital audio tracks for pre-mixing or final mixing in creating motion picture sound tracks. They also offer individual track slipping in multiple track configurations, random access recall, and both destructive and non-destructive editing capabilities, eliminating the requirements for razor blade conforming.
Citation: To FAIRLIGHT for the design and development of the DAD digital audio dubber specifically designed for the motion picture industry.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: [These] digital audio dubbers have afforded the post-production community a faster, more cost-effective means of playing back hundreds of digital audio tracks for pre-mixing or final mixing in creating motion picture sound tracks. They also offer individual track slipping in multiple track configurations, random access recall, and both destructive and non-destructive editing capabilities, eliminating the requirements for razor blade conforming.
Citation: To ADVANCED DIGITAL SYSTEMS GROUP (ADSG) for the design and development of the Sony DADR 5000 digital audio dubber specifically designed for the motion picture industry.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: [These] digital audio dubbers have afforded the post-production community a faster, more cost-effective means of playing back hundreds of digital audio tracks for pre-mixing or final mixing in creating motion picture sound tracks. They also offer individual track slipping in multiple track configurations, random access recall, and both destructive and non-destructive editing capabilities, eliminating the requirements for razor blade conforming.
Citation: To TIMELINE, INCORPORATED for the design and development of the MMR 8 digital audio dubber specifically designed for the motion picture industry.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Leonard Pincus, Ashot Nalbandyan, George Johnson, Thomas Kong, David Pringle
Note: With the ability to dim these very high powered lights at essentially constant Kelvin temperature and without flicker, these units produce a bright and even light source for general set lighting. The availability of very high wattage units allows production to extend the hours of work past the time when the crew would otherwise have \"lost the light.\"
Citation: To LEONARD PINCUS, ASHOT NALBANDYAN, GEORGE JOHNSON, THOMAS KONG and DAVID PRINGLE for the design and development of the SoftSun low pressure xenon long-arc light sources, their power supplies and fixtures.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Considered a standard of the industry, the Fan Descender provides a means for significantly increasing the safety of very high stunt falls. The system permits falls to be made under controlled deceleration and with a highly predictable stopping point without limitation of camera angles.
Citation: To VIC ARMSTRONG for the refinement and application to the film industry of the Fan Descender for accurately and safely arresting the descent of stunt persons in high freefalls.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This unique photographic scenic backing allows a smooth transition from day to night views with a single backing. The Roscolight backings provide an important new creative tool to filmmakers, saving time, money and stage space.
Citation: To PHILIP GREENSTREET of Rosco Laboratories for the concept and development of the Roscolight Day/Night Backdrop.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Udo Schauss, Hildegard Ebbesmeier, Karl Lenhardt, Ralf Linn, Norbert Brinker
Note: These projection lenses provide a significant improvement in the quality of the cinema viewing experience.
Citation: To UDO SCHAUSS, HILDEGARD EBBESMEIER and KARL LENHARDT for the optical design, and RALF LINN and NORBERT BRINKER for the mechanical design of the Schneider Super Cinelux lenses for motion picture projection.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Glenn M. Berggren, Horst Linge, Wolfgang Reinecke
Note: The unique optical design of the Ultra-Star Plus projection lenses achieves unprecedented edge-to-edge uniformity of illumination, combined with a significant increase in screen brightness, thus providing a substantial improvement in the cinema viewing experience.
Citation: To GLENN M. BERGGREN for the concept, HORST LINGE for research and development, and WOLFGANG REINECKE for the optical design of the ISCO Ultra-Star Plus lenses for motion picture projection.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: BILL TONDREAU, ALVAH J. MILLER, PAUL JOHNSON, DAVID STUMP
Note: These systems digitally record live action camera and axis data with practically no impact on the live action production process, allowing compositing for visual effects to become faster and more cost-effective.
Citation: To BILL TONDREAU of Kuper Systems, ALVAH J. MILLER and PAUL JOHNSON of Lynx Robotics, and DAVID STUMP of Visual Effects Rental Services for the conception, design and development of data capture systems that enable superior accuracy, efficiency and economy in the creation of composite imagery.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This system streamlines the creation of 3D computer graphics models by allowing artists to convert the data from automatically scanned physical models into a user-specified configuration of patches well suited for use in computer applications.
Citation: To VENKAT KRISHNAMURTHY for the creation of the Paraform Software for 3D Digital Form Development.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: George Borshukov, Kim Libreri, Dan Piponi
Note: This component of the Manex Visual Effects Virtual Cinematography System provides theatrical-quality virtual settings.
Citation: To GEORGE BORSHUKOV, KIM LIBRERI and DAN PIPONI for the development of a system for image-based rendering allowing choreographed camera movements through computer graphic reconstructed sets.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: The LAD system has become the standard method used by film laboratories and digital film recording facilities for the effecient and uniform control of color and exposure in camera negatives, interpositives and duplicate negatives.
Citation: To JOHN P. PYTLAK for the development of the Laboratory Aim Density (LAD) system.

Nominees: Ioan Allen, Robin Bransbury, Mark Harrah
Note: The adoption of the TASA loudness standard has led directly to better sound in the cinema for trailers and features alike.
Citation: To Ioan Allen for the concept, Robin Bransbury for the design and Mark Harrah for the implementation of the Trailer Audio Standards Association (TASA) Loudness Standard.

CanonicalCategory: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Category: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Citation: To N. Paul Kenworthy, Jr. in appreciation for outstanding service and dedication in upholding the high standards of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

Edmund M. Di Giulio

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: John M. Eargle, D.B. Keele, Mark E. Engebretson
Note: The work of John M. Eargle, D.B. \"Don\" Keele and Mark E. Engebretson has resulted in the over 20-year dominance of constant-directivity, direct radiator bass style cinema loudspeaker systems.
Citation: To JOHN M. EARGLE, D.B. \"DON\" KEELE and MARK E. ENGEBRETSON for the concept, design and engineering of the modern constant-directivity, direct radiator style motion picture loudspeaker systems.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: This compact, wide-angle, macro focus lens enhances and expands the picture-capturing ability, both technically and artistically, of the cinematographer. It is the first cine lens that allows macro photography while still being able to zoom.
Citation: To IAIN NEIL for the concept and optical design and AL SAIKI for the mechanical design of the Panavision Primo Macro Zoom Lens (PMZ).

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Franz Kraus, Johannes Steurer, Wolfgang Riedel
Note: The ARRILASER film recorder demonstrates a high level of engineering resulting in a compact, user-friendly, low-maintenance device while at the same time maintaining outstanding speed, exposure ratings and image quality.
Citation: To FRANZ KRAUS, JOHANNES STEURER and WOLFGANG RIEDEL for the design and development of the ARRILASER Film Recorder.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Peter Kuran, Sean Coughlin, Joseph A. Olivier, William Conner
Note: This photo-chemical process restores color to faded color negative using off-the-shelf film stocks with a unique approach. The resulting film intermediate can be used to create a new internegative.
Citation: To PETER KURAN for the invention, and SEAN COUGHLIN, JOSEPH A. OLIVIER and WILLIAM CONNER for the engineering and development of the RCI-Color Film Restoration Process.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: This liquid-gate optical printer offers ease of set-up and change-over to various formats from 35mm to 65mm 15-perf with both additive and subtractive lamp houses.
Citation: To MAKOTO TSUKADA, SHOJI KANEKO and the TECHNICAL STAFF OF IMAGICA CORPORATION, and DAIJIRO FUJIE of Nikon Corporation for the engineering excellence and the impact on the motion picture industry of the Imagica 65/35 Multi-Format Optical Printer.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Steven Gerlach, Gregory Farrell, Christian Lurin
Note: Allowing all four soundtrack systems to be exposed on a single negative with relative ease, this stock has allowed single inventory prints, facilitating the more economic distribution of motion pictures.
Citation: To STEVEN GERLACH, GREGORY FARRELL and CHRISTIAN LURIN for the design, engineering and implementation of the Kodak Panchromatic Sound Recording Film.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Paul J. Constantine, Peter M. Constantine
Note: CELCO recorder products have had a significant impact on the industry through continual improvements in their technology.
Citation: To PAUL J. CONSTANTINE and PETER M. CONSTANTINE for the design and development of the CELCO Digital Film Recorder products.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: The Remote AquaCam brings to the industry an underwater camera housing specifically designed for remote and high-speed operation. Its hydro-dynamic shape facilitates ease of operation for surface hand-held filming, and its remote capabilities allow it to film in confined areas or in situations where an operator cannot be near the camera.
Citation: To PETE ROMANO for the design and development of the Remote AquaCam, an underwater camera housing system for use in motion pictures.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: With over 50 years of involvement in the design and development of underwater camera housings, Jordan Klein's work has had significant influence in the field of underwater photography.
Citation: To JORDAN KLEIN for his pioneering efforts in the development and application of underwater camera housings for motion pictures.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Employing both tapered line array and filtered line array technologies and unique passive and active filter networks, their work with cinema loudspeakers was both innovative and dedicated specifically to cinema applications.
Citation: To BERNARD M. WERNER and WILLIAM GELOW for the engineering and design of filtered line arrays and screen spreading compensation as applied to motion picture loudspeaker systems.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: For over 20 years Tomlinson Holman has been involved in the research and integration of the constant-directivity, direct radiator bass type of cinema loudspeaker systems.
Citation: To TOMLINSON HOLMAN for the research and systems integration resulting in the improvement of motion picture loudspeaker systems.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This well-engineered camera motor features built-in time-lapse programmability and is useful in an unusually wide range of applications, including MOS production filming, high-speed photography, animation and motion control.
Citation: To GEOFF JACKSON and ROGER WOODBURN for their DMS 120S Camera Motor.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Thomas Major Barron, Chas Smith, Gordon Seitz
Note: This motion control camera crane represents an unprecedented combination of long reach, high speed, and a novel approach to its transport, which allows a very rapid setup on location.
Citation: To THOMAS MAJOR BARRON for the overall concept and design; CHAS SMITH for the structural engineering; and GORDON SEITZ for the mechanical engineering of the Bulldog Motion Control Camera Crane.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: John R. Anderson, Jim Hourihan, Cary Phillips, Sebastian Marino
Note: This system makes hair, clothing, skin, flesh and muscle simulation both directable and integrated within a character animation and rigging environment.
Citation: To JOHN R. ANDERSON, JIM HOURIHAN, CARY PHILLIPS and SEBASTIAN MARINO for the development of the ILM Creature Dynamics System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: The MARS system provides analysis of camera motion and object motion, and their dimensions. It employs a rich set of user-interface tools and sophisticated algorithms.
Citation: To STEVE SULLIVAN and ERIC R.L. SCHAFER for the development of the ILM Motion and Structure Recovery System (MARS).

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: CELCO recorder products have had a significant impact on the industry through continual improvements in their technology.
Citation: To CARL LUDWIG and JOHN M. CONSTANTINE, JR. for their contributions to CELCO Digital Film Recorder products.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Bill Spitzak, Paul Van Camp, Jonathan Egstad, Price Pethel
Note: The Nuke-2D compositing software allows for the creation of complex interactive digital composites using relatively modest computing hardware.
Citation: To BILL SPITZAK, PAUL VAN CAMP, JONATHAN EGSTAD and PRICE PETHEL for their pioneering effort on the NUKE-2D Compositing Software.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: The ongoing influence of Lance Williams is exemplified in his three seminal papers \"Casting Shadows on Curved Surfaces,\" \"Pyramidal Parametrics\" and \"View Interpolation for Image Synthesis.\"
Citation: To DR. LANCE J. WILLIAMS for his pioneering influence in the field of computer-generated animation and effects for motion pictures.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This dominant commercial tracking system provides \"survey-free\" tracking, which significantly reduces the need for painstaking, error-prone measurements on sets.
Citation: To DR. UWE SASSENBERG and ROLF SCHNEIDER for the development of \"3D Equalizer,\" an advanced and robust camera and object match-moving system.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: All current cel painting applications in the motion picture industry can be traced back to the original idea and pioneering implementation of Garland Stern.
Citation: To DR. GARLAND STERN for the concept and implementation of the Cel Paint Software System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This self-contained, low bed picture car carrier and camera platform enables the safe, economic and realistic filming of action sequences that may involve principal actors and dialogue.
Citation: To MIC RODGERS and MATT SWEENEY for the concept, design and realization of the \"Mic Rig.\"

Note: The Super 16mm film format has achieved a significant impact on the worldwide film industry by playing a major role in empowering low budget films to be produced for theatrical release.
Citation: To Rune Ericson for his pioneering development and 30 years of dedication to the Super 16mm format for motion pictures.

Note: Born from \"The Cinematographic Annual,\" first published by the ASC in 1930, the \"American Cinematographer Manual\" has become an essential bible for cinematographers. Currently in its eighth edition, this premier reference manual has had a significant impact on decades of motion picture photography around the world.
Citation: To the American Society of Cinematographers (ASC) for the continued publication of the \"American Cinematographer Manual.\"

Name: Written by Carlos Cuarón and Alfonso Cuarón

Citation: To Peter O'Toole, whose remarkable talents have provided cinema history with some of its most memorable characters.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Note: With its significant and dominant impact on the motion picture industry, the Maya software package offers a robust and widely used commercial visual effects tool with a rich infrastructure for extension and customization.
Citation: To ALIAS/WAVEFRONT for the development of a 3D animation, dynamics, modeling and rendering production tool known as Maya.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Nominees: ARNOLD & RICHTER CINE TECHNIK, PANAVISION INC.
Note: With a commitment that lies beyond the usual commercial considerations, these two manufacturers continue to lead the industry in developing and introducing products that have defined the state of the art in motion picture camera technology.
Citation: To ARNOLD & RICHTER CINE TECHNIK and PANAVISION INC., for their continuing development and innovation in the design and manufacturing of advanced camera systems specifically designed for the motion picture entertainment industry.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: This innovative design employs advanced hard disk recording technology and digital audio techniques for use in both production and post-production recording applications.
Citation: To GLENN SANDERS and HOWARD STARK of Zaxcom for the concept, design and engineering of the portable Deva Digital Audio Disk Recorder.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Mark Elendt, Paul H. Breslin, Greg Hermanovic, Kim Davidson
Note: Through a procedural building-block process, the Houdini software is used to simulate natural phenomena using particle effects and complex three-dimensional models.
Citation: To MARK ELENDT, PAUL H. BRESLIN, GREG HERMANOVIC and KIM DAVIDSON for their continued development of the procedural modeling and animation components of their Prisms program, as exemplified in the Houdini software package.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Dr. Leslie Gutierrez, Diane E. Kestner, James Merrill, David Niklewicz
Note: This film stock provides filmmakers with enhanced color saturation, higher contrast and darker blacks, producing a bold, colorful 'look' on the theater screen.
Citation: To DR. LESLIE GUTIERREZ, DIANE E. KESTNER, JAMES MERRILL and DAVID NIKLEWICZ for the design and development of the Kodak Vision Premier Color Print Film, 2393.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Dedo Weigert, Dr. Depu Jin, Franz Petters
Note: This uniquely designed set light provides superior performance, reliability and ease of use. Combined with its excellent array of accessories, the Dedolight 400D is an outstanding engineering achievement.
Citation: To DEDO WEIGERT for the concept, DR. DEPU JIN for the optical calculations, and FRANZ PETTERS for the mechanical construction of the Dedolight 400D.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This effective software simulation system is used to create and control natural, expressive, highly-nuanced facial animation on a wide range of computer-generated characters.
Citation: To DICK WALSH for the development of the PDI/DreamWorks Facial Animation System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Mental Ray is a highly programmable computer-graphics renderer incorporating ray tracing and global illumination to realistically simulate the behavior of light in computer-generated imagery.
Citation: To THOMAS DRIEMEYER and to the TEAM OF MATHEMATICIANS, PHYSICISTS AND SOFTWARE ENGINEERS OF MENTAL IMAGES for their contributions to the Mental Ray rendering software for motion pictures.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Eric Daniels, George Katanics, Tasso Lappas, Chris Springfield
Note: The Deep Canvas software program captures the orginal brush strokes of the traditional background artist to render elements in three dimensions for animated films.
Citation: To ERIC DANIELS, GEORGE KATANICS, TASSO LAPPAS and CHRIS SPRINGFIELD for the development of the Deep Canvas rendering software.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: The work of Jim Songer from 1968 through 1973 led directly to the more widespread acceptance of video-assist in the motion picture industry.
Citation: To JIM SONGER for his contributions to the technical development of video-assist in the motion picture industry.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: These helium-filled balloons with internal arrangements for tungsten halogen and HMI light sources, are usable indoors or out, quick to set up, require essentially no rigging and provide a soft light that can cover a very large area.
Citation: To PIERRE CHABERT of Airstar for the introduction of balloons with internal light sources to provide set lighting for the motion picture industry.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: These helium-filled balloons with internal arrangements for tungsten halogen and HMI light sources, are usable indoors or out, quick to set up, require essentially no rigging and provide a soft light that can cover a very large area.
Citation: To RAWDON HAYNE and ROBERT W. JEFFS of Leelium Tubelites for their contributions to the development of internally lit balloons for motion picture lighting.

Peter D. Parks

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Note: The efficient algorithms, extensible architecture and intuitive interface have enabled Pro Tools to become the worldwide standard for the creation and editing of motion picture soundtracks.
Citation: To DIGIDESIGN for the design, development and implementation of the Pro Tools® digital audio workstation.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Note: Measuring his valuable contributions to the invention and implementation of robotic camera systems in decades rather than years, his efforts have aided motion control in becoming a core technology that has supported the renaissance of visual effects.
Citation: To BILL TONDREAU of Kuper Controls for his significant advancements in the field of motion control technology for motion picture visual effects.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: This high-speed studio projector produces an image quality equal to projectors with Geneva movements. With its unparalleled shuttle speed, reversibility and acceleration, this projector has set a new standard for post-production viewing as well as in traditional screening facilities.
Citation: To KINOTON GmbH for the engineering and development of the Kinoton FP 30/38 EC II Studio Projector.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Kenneth L. Tingler, CHARLES C. ANDERSON, DIANE E. KESTNER and BRIAN A. SCHELL
Note: This technology successfully controls the static charge buildup on processed intermediate and sound negative films during high speed printing operations.
Citation: To KENNETH L. TINGLER, CHARLES C. ANDERSON, DIANE E. KESTNER and BRIAN A. SCHELL of the Eastman Kodak Company for the successful development of a process-surviving antistatic layer technology for motion picture film.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Christopher Alfred, Andrew J. Cannon, Michael C. Carlos, Mark Crabtree, Chuck Grindstaff, John Melanson
Note: Through their respective pioneering efforts with AMS AudioFile, Waveframe and Fairlight, the work of these gentlemen contributed significantly to the development and realization of digital audio workstations with full editing capabilities for motion picture soundtracks.
Citation: To CHRISTOPHER ALFRED, ANDREW J. CANNON, MICHAEL C. CARLOS, MARK CRABTREE, CHUCK GRINDSTAFF and JOHN MELANSON for their significant contributions to the evolution of digital audio editing for motion picture post production.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: Massive takes a new approach in simulating behaviors of large numbers of computer-generated extras a.k.a. \"agents.\" Each \"agent\" contains a primitive software \"brain\" used to develop behavioral rules simulating a wide range of behaviors. In \"The Lord of the Rings\" trilogy, over 200,000 agents were controlled in several scenes.
Citation: To STEPHEN REGELOUS for the design and development of Massive, the autonomous agent animation system used for the battle sequences in \"The Lord of the Rings\" trilogy.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Kish Sadhvani, Paul Duclos, Carl Pernicone
Note: This versatile, modular and widely accepted cine viewfinder system is capable of properly displaying images in multiple formats ranging from 35mm anamorphic to super 16.
Citation: To KISH SADHVANI for the concept and optical design, PAUL DUCLOS for the practical realization and production engineering and CARL PERNICONE for the mechanical design and engineering of the portable cine viewfinder system known as the Ultimate Director's Finder (UDF).

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Henrik Wann Jensen, Stephen R. Marschner, Pat Hanrahan
Note: This mathematical model contributed substantially to the development and implementation of practical techniques for simulating subsurface scattering of light in translucent materials for computer-generated images in motion pictures.
Citation: To HENRIK WANN JENSEN, STEPHEN R. MARSCHNER and PAT HANRAHAN for their pioneering research in simulating subsurface scattering of light in translucent materials as presented in their paper \"A Practical Model for Subsurface Light Transport.\"

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Christophe Hery, KEN McGAUGH, Joe Letteri
Note: These groundbreaking techniques were used to create realistic-looking skin on digitally created characters.
Citation: To CHRISTOPHE HERY, KEN McGAUGH and JOE LETTERI for their groundbreaking implementations of practical methods for rendering skin and other translucent materials using subsurface scattering techniques.

Category: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
Citation: To Douglas Greenfield in appreciation for outstanding service and dedication in upholding the high standards of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

Name: Written by Keir Pearson & Terry George

Citation: To Sidney Lumet in recognition of his brilliant services to screenwriters, performers and the art of the motion picture.
Takuo Miyagishima

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Note: With its electronically driven leveling head, adjustable moveable weight carriage, and lightweight, extremely precise telescoping beam elements that allow camera movement during shots, the Technocrane has redefined the state-of-the-art in camera crane technology.
Citation: To HORST BURBULLA for the invention and continuing development of the Technocrane telescoping camera crane.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
Nominees: Jean-Marie Lavalou, Alain Masseron, David Samuelson
Note: The Louma pioneered a remotely-operated camera head combined with a lightweight and portable modular crane. Its design has proved to be the inspiration for numerous subsequent remote camera systems.
Citation: To JEAN-MARIE LAVALOU, ALAIN MASSERON and DAVID SAMUELSON for the engineering and development of the Louma Camera Crane and remote system for motion picture production.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Note: With its electronically driven leveling head, adjustable moveable weight carriage, and lightweight, extremely precise telescoping beam elements that allow camera movement during shots, the Technocrane has redefined the state-of-the-art in camera crane technology.
Citation: To GYULA MESTER (electronic systems design) and KEITH EDWARDS (mechanical engineering) for their significant contributions to and continuing development of the Technocrane telescoping camera crane.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Lindsay Arnold, Guy Griffiths, David Hodson, Charlie Lawrence, David Mann
Note: Cineon pioneered a commercial node-graph compositing system establishing a new visual method for direct manipulation of the compositing process, which influenced and defined modern digital compositing workflows.
Citation: To LINDSAY ARNOLD, GUY GRIFFITHS, DAVID HODSON, CHARLIE LAWRENCE and DAVID MANN for their development of the Cineon Digital Film Workstation.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: This proprietary modified silicone makeup system allows for the creation of either partial or full-face appliances for motion picture makeup effects that move like real flesh, have translucency similar to skin and will accept standard makeup materials.
Citation: To GREG CANNOM and WESLEY WOFFORD for the development of their special modified silicone material for makeup appliances used in motion pictures.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: With its large radiating surface and thin profile, this collapsible, self-contained HMI softlight provides a diffuse light to simulate daylight in location interiors, where space is often limited.
Citation: To JERRY COTTS for the original concept and design and ANTHONY SEAMAN for the engineering of the Satellight-X HMI Softlight.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: Designed in the early 1990s when digital signal processing was in its early stages, the real-time digital approach of the DNF 001 provided accurate filter response with minimal interaction, allowing noise attenuation with fewer artifacts.
Citation: To STEVEN E. BOZE for the design and implementation of the DNF 001 multi-band digital audio noise suppressor.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: The Cedar DNS 1000 is specifically designed to reduce background noise from recorded motion picture dialog. With its precise filters it allows the frequency ranges to be altered or even cascaded to pinpoint and reduce the offending noise.
Citation: To DR. CHRISTOPHER HICKS and DAVE BETTS for the design and implementation of the Cedar DNS 1000 multi-band digital noise suppressor.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: As a pioneer in this area of motion picture technology, Tyler's 2-axis, hydraulically-powered camera mount successfully eliminates the pitch and roll associated with camera shots taken from a boat in the water.
Citation: To NELSON TYLER for the development of the Tyler Gyroplatform boat mount stabilizing device for motion picture photography.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Dr. Julian Morris, Michael Birch, Dr. Paul Smyth, Paul Tate
Note: Vicon Motion Systems developed special-purpose cameras for motion capture with software systems that maximized their impact on the motion picture industry.
Citation: To DR. JULIAN MORRIS, MICHAEL BIRCH, DR. PAUL SMYTH and PAUL TATE for the development of the Vicon motion capture technology.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Dr. John O.B. Greaves, Ned Phipps, Antonie J. Van Den Bogert, William Hayes
Note: Motion Analysis Corporation developed special-purpose cameras for motion capture with software systems that maximized their impact on the motion picture industry.
Citation: To DR. JOHN O.B. GREAVES, NED PHIPPS, ANTONIE J. VAN DEN BOGERT and WILLIAM HAYES for the development of the Motion Analysis motion capture technology.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Dr. Nels Madsen, Vaughn Cato, Matthew Madden, Bill Lorton
Note: The software solution created by Giant Studios applied a unique biometric approach that has influenced the development of motion capture technology for motion pictures.
Citation: To DR. NELS MADSEN, VAUGHN CATO, MATTHEW MADDEN and BILL LORTON for the development of the Giant Studios motion capture technology.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Note: \"Storm\" employs an efficient method for directly manipulating volumetric data to create effects such as clouds, water and avalanches with familiar operators inspired by image compositing and painting operations.
Citation: To ALAN KAPLER for the design and development of \"Storm,\" a software toolkit for artistic control of volumetric effects.

To Arthur Widmer for his lifetime of achievement in the science and technology of image compositing for motion pictures as exemplified by his significant contributions to the development of the Ultra Violet and the \"bluescreen\" compositing processes.
